content: Some very odd people R saying I’m a pedo, re: a joke from a time not that long ago when hard absurd jokes by comedians were acknowledged for what they were — jokes — not a disengenuous national threat to people fake-clutching their pearls (whilst ranting the country’s too PC)

See, those aren’t jokes.

Here’s a joke:

Hi Sarah! How’ve you been? You look so great! How’s your mustache doing today?”

"Pearl clutcher" - nice attempt at gaslighting by deploying what is intended to a thought-terminating cliche. I'm surprised you didn't whip out "Satanic panic!".
As far as dismissive terms which are nonetheless sometimes apt, "you are such a disappointment" is more a case of virtue-signaling than pearl-clutching.
“You are such a disappointment “ was a sincere expression of how I feel. I’ve never clutched a pearl nor ever signaled a virtue.
Sorry, I didn't mean to put the kibosh on a sincere expression of feeling. I think I heard those words in my head as being self-important when that's not what you meant.
Thank you. I really appreciate that.
